docs.lead_paragraph: Sylvia Mathews Burwell sailed through confirmation hearings before two Senate committees, where she promised to be candid and cooperative in working with Congress.

headline.main: Burwell Wins Confirmation as Secretary of Health
headline.print_headline: Burwell Wins Confirmation as Secretary of Health

docs.abstract: Senate confirms nomination of Sylvia Mathews Burwell to be secretary of health and human services; she promises to be candid and cooperative in working with Congress.
docs.snippet: Sylvia Mathews Burwell sailed through confirmation hearings before two Senate committees, where she promised to be candid and cooperative in working with Congress.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration is revamping the health insurance marketplace HealthCare.gov and removing significant parts from it to ensure that glitches on the site do not return, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing presentations to health insurers and interviews with government officials and contractors.

headline.main: Obama Administration Revamps Federal Healthcare Website: WSJ
headline.print_headline: Obama Administration Revamps Federal Healthcare Website: WSJ

docs.snippet: The Obama administration is revamping the health insurance marketplace HealthCare.gov and removing significant parts from it to ensure that glitches on the site do not return, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing presentations to health insurers...

docs.lead_paragraph: A New Jersey appeals court ruled on Thursday that First Amendment protections allowing people to refuse medical procedures on religious grounds also extends to those opting out of treatment for secular reasons.

headline.main: New Jersey Court Rules for Nurse Who Refused Vaccine on Non-Religious Grounds
headline.print_headline: New Jersey Court Rules for Nurse Who Refused Vaccine on Non-Religious Grounds

docs.snippet: A New Jersey appeals court ruled on Thursday that First Amendment protections allowing people to refuse medical procedures on religious grounds also extends to those opting out of treatment for secular reasons.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate on Thursday confirmed Sylvia Mathews Burwell as President Barack Obama's new health secretary, making her chiefly responsible for implementing the controversial healthcare law known as Obamacare.

headline.main: Senate Approves Burwell as Health Secretary
headline.print_headline: Senate Approves Burwell as Health Secretary

docs.snippet: The Senate on Thursday confirmed Sylvia Mathews Burwell as President Barack Obama's new health secretary, making her chiefly responsible for implementing the controversial healthcare law known as Obamacare.

docs.lead_paragraph: New management, same problems. Sylvia Mathews Burwell was confirmed Thursday as the nation's new health secretary, but she'll have to act quickly to head off more insurance chaos this fall.

headline.main: Senate Confirms Obama's New Health Secretary
headline.print_headline: Senate Confirms Obama's New Health Secretary

docs.snippet: New management, same problems. Sylvia Mathews Burwell was confirmed Thursday as the nation's new health secretary, but she'll have to act quickly to head off more insurance chaos this fall.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge has granted nearly 200 Catholic employers an injunction to temporarily prevent the U.S. government from forcing them to provide insurance coverage for contraceptives.

headline.main: Catholic Group Exempt From Contraceptives Rule
headline.print_headline: Catholic Group Exempt From Contraceptives Rule

docs.snippet: A federal judge has granted nearly 200 Catholic employers an injunction to temporarily prevent the U.S. government from forcing them to provide insurance coverage for contraceptives.

headline.main: Morning Agenda: Sprint and T-Mobile Near a Deal of Their Own

docs.abstract: Sprint and T-Mobile have settled on the terms of a $32 billion deal. | A maverick judge leaves his mark. | Valeant’s opaque business model has been revealed. | Assessing the effects of a multibillion-dollar penalty on BNP’s capital.
docs.snippet: Sprint and T-Mobile have settled on the terms of a $32 billion deal. | A maverick judge leaves his mark. | Valeant’s opaque business model has been revealed. | Assessing the effects of a multibillion-dollar penalty on BNP’s capital.

docs.lead_paragraph: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) cut its 2015 economic growth forecast for China to about 7 percent, but urged authorities to avoid further stimulus measures and concentrate on curtailing financial risks instead.

headline.main: IMF Cuts China's Growth Forecast but Urges Focus on Reforms
headline.print_headline: IMF Cuts China's Growth Forecast but Urges Focus on Reforms

docs.snippet: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) cut its 2015 economic growth forecast for China to about 7 percent, but urged authorities to avoid further stimulus measures and concentrate on curtailing financial risks instead.

docs.lead_paragraph: California Chrome's bid for the Triple Crown on Saturday is likely to boost TV ratings and, if he wins, create a star for a sport that could badly use one.

headline.main: Few Certainties in Calculating Triple Crown Value
headline.print_headline: Few Certainties in Calculating Triple Crown Value

docs.snippet: California Chrome's bid for the Triple Crown on Saturday is likely to boost TV ratings and, if he wins, create a star for a sport that could badly use one.

docs.lead_paragraph: Many of the 8 million people who signed up for coverage under President Barack Obama's health care now have an asterisk next to their names.
